title: Make a trait of EventWatcher
body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

This is to implement [L1 adaptor](https://github.com/cryptoeconomicslab/plasma-rust-framework/issues/258).

## Describe the solution you'd like

* Make a trait
* Switch by feature

see https://github.com/tomusdrw/rust-web3/blob/f043b222744580bf4be043da757ab0b300c3b2da/src/transports/http.rs#L186.

title: Fix vulnerability in offline swap
body:
## Describe the bug

there is a potential attack in the current offline swap claim by withholding.

## To Reproduce

An operator can withhold swap state.

## New claim

A maker exchanges her/his ETH with DAI.

Maker(ETH) <-> Taker(DAI)

1. A maker makes order state for her/his ETH range
2. A taker makes took state for ETH range
3. At same time, the taker makes for DAI range

### 1. Order state(ETH)

Combining maker and taker state.
A maker signs this state.

```
make_order(maker, c_token, c_amount) := {
  Or(
    And(exit_correspondent(maker, c_token, c_amount), SignedBy(taker)),
    And(Not(exit_correspondent(maker, c_token, c_amount)), SignedBy(maker))
  )
}

withdraw(su) := exit(su) and deposit_exists(su.token, su.range)

exit_correspondent(maker, c_token, c_amount):=
  ∃ c_su ∈ SU: (
    CheckAmount(c_su.range, c_amount)
    and c_su.token == c_token
    and c_su.owner == maker // <- how?
    and (withdraw(c_su) or c_su.condition())
  )
```

### 2. Took state(ETH)

```
ownership(owner=taker)
```

### 3. Took state(DAI)

```
// This is regular online swap
swap(new_owner=maker, pre_owner=taker, correspondent=took_eth_su)
```

## References

* https://github.com/cryptoeconomicslab/chamber-lang/blob/master/examples/order.txt

title: How OVM compiler works
body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Current opening channel property is very big size.
I'll try to compile that and show how it works.
Basic idea is compiling big property to one small property and expand it in other clients.

On smart contract, there are 2 ideas.

1. expand property on smart contract.
2. A developer deploy compiled predicate.

I think 2. has a challenge about how do we synthesize multiple predicates.

title: Tasks after Oct
body:
## Overview

* Recompose next tasks for universal client/framework
* L2 framework spec. https://hackmd.io/@syuhei/HJRKfUOwr
* Multi platform client

title: Client should sync block 0
body:
## Describe the bug

We should modify `insert_test_ranges` both client side and aggregator side. I tried to fetch plasma_block at block 0(block 0 is test data) from client, however it was failed. We should fix this.

Or, client should sync all blocks they don't fetch?

## alternative

Implement Deposit?

title: Shared local information storage
body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

We need shared local information storage for complex OVM client construction.
For instance, swap on plasma requires storing corresponding signature.

## Describe the solution you'd like

- Common local information storage for offline action e.g) swap
- Pubsub for online action e.g) channel

title: state channel exit claim
body:
I think we should define all applications as "nestable" and we can define nestable claim as 3 claims, open, dispute and close. Additionally, I guess open and close claims are available for not nested state channel. Open and close claims can be evaluated by L1 smart contract.

```
Open claim --deprecate-> Close claim
```
or
```
Open claim --> Dispute claim
```

### Open 


```
open(message) := ForAllSuchThat(
  MessageQuantifier,
  "message"
  Not(close(message))
)
```

### Close claim

```
close(message) := And(
  SignedBy(myAddress, hash("close", message)),
  SignedBy(counterPartyAddress, hash("close", message)),
)
```

### disput claim

```
And(
  SignedBy(counterPartyAddress, mostRecentMessage),
  ForAllSuchThat(
    SignedByQuantifier(myAddress, channelId),
    "message"
    MessageNonceLessThanDecider(message, nonce + 1)
  )
)
```

title: Prototype of applications
body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Develop frontend of OVM applications to show what we can do with OVM and our framework.

## Describe the solution you'd like

We can reuse https://github.com/cryptoeconomicslab/wallet/

priority

- Payment with fast finality
- Dex(Order book)
  - Home(Balance, orders, history)
  - Transaction form
- Voting
- Game
- Dex(general state like uniswap, PG is going to work this)

title: Using generic Hash type and Hashing type on MerkleTree.

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

body:
Recommend to use a generic hash function on MerkleTree.

For example:
```
pub struct MerkleTree<H, Hashing> 
  where H: rstd::hash::Hash + AsRef<[u8]> + AsMut<[u8]> + Copy + Default,
  Hashing: Hash<Output=H> {{
	_phantom: PhantomData<(H, Hashing)>,
}
```
